workflow.critical: The workflow execution engine is governed by: {project-root}/_bmad/core/tasks/workflow.xml
You MUST have already loaded and processed: {installed_path}/workflow.yaml
Communicate all responses in {communication_language} and language MUST be tailored to {user_skill_level}
workflow.objective: This workflow runs AFTER implementing fixes for review action items. It finds completed action items ([x]) with PR comment links, posts "Fixed" comments, and resolves the threads.
workflow.design-notes:
**Why no commit SHA in responses:** - Gives operator flexibility about when to commit (before or after running this workflow) - Avoids issues when commits are amended (SHA changes, references become invalid) - The "Fixed" message is sufficient - reviewers can see the fix in the PR diff
**Thread resolution:** - GitHub REST API does NOT support resolving review threads - Must use GraphQL API with `resolveReviewThread` mutation - Requires thread node ID (PRRT_...), not comment ID

step.goal: Load story and find completed action items with PR links
step.action: Use provided {{story_path}} or ask user which story file to review

check.if: Review Follow-ups section does NOT exist
check.output:
No "Review Follow-ups (AI)" section found in story.
This workflow requires: - Story with "Review Follow-ups (AI)" section - Action items marked [x] as complete - PR comment links in action items
Exiting.

step.action: Parse all action items looking for: - Checkbox status: [x] (completed) vs [ ] (pending) - PR comment links (single): `[PR#123 comment](https://github.com/.../discussion_r...)` - PR comment links (multiple/grouped): `[PR#123 comments: [Label1](url1), [Label2](url2), ...]`

Filter to completed action items with PR links: - Extract: checkbox status, severity, description, file reference, PR number - Extract ALL comment URLs and IDs (may be multiple per action item) - Store as {{completed_with_pr_links}} list, each entry containing: - Action item details - Array of {comment_url, comment_id} for all linked PR comments - is_grouped: true if multiple PR comments, false if single

check.if: no completed action items with PR links
check.output:
No completed action items with PR comment links found.
Current status: - Total action items: {{total_action_items}} - Completed: {{completed_count}} - With PR links: {{pr_link_count}} - Completed WITH PR links: 0
Either: 1. No action items are marked [x] yet 2. No action items have PR comment links 3. All PR comments already resolved
Nothing to do. Exiting.

step.goal: Detect GitHub PR and verify access
step.action: Check if current directory is a Git repository with GitHub remote
Extract owner and repo from GitHub remote URL

check.if: not a git repository OR no GitHub remote
check.output:
Not a GitHub repository. This workflow requires: - Git repository - GitHub remote configured - GitHub CLI (gh) installed and authenticated
Exiting.

step.action: Extract PR number from first completed action item's PR link
Verify PR exists using: `gh pr view {{pr_number}} --json number,url,title,state`

check.if: PR not found OR PR is closed
check.output:
PR #{{pr_number}} is {{pr_state}}.
Cannot resolve comments on a closed PR. The action items are complete in the story, but PR comment threads cannot be resolved.
Exiting.

step.goal: Post Fixed comments and resolve threads
step.critical: Follow .claude/README.md guidelines for PR comment responses
Do NOT include commit SHA in responses - this gives operator flexibility about when to commit
step.action: Read {claude_readme} Pull Request Review Responses section
step.output:
**Marking {{completed_pr_count}} PR Comments as Resolved**
Following .claude/README.md guidelines: - Using /comments/COMMENT_ID/replies endpoint for threaded responses - Posting "Fixed" confirmation - Resolving threads via GraphQL API
Processing each comment...

step.action:
Add completion note to story's Dev Agent Record - Completion Notes List:
**{{date}} - PR Comments Resolved:** - Resolved {{posted_count}} PR comment threads - Marked completed action items as fixed - PR: #{{pr_number}}
